body_html: DropoutWrapper does not have variables because it does not itself store any. It wraps a cell that may have variables; but it's not clear what the semantics should be if you access the DropoutWrapper.variables. For example, all keras layers only report back the variables that they own; and so only one layer ever owns any variable. That said, this should probably return [], and the reason it doesn't is that DropoutWrapper never calls super().__init__ in its constructor. That should be an easy fix; PRs welcome.

That said, this should probably return [], and the reason it doesn't is that DropoutWrapper never calls super().__init__ in its constructor.  That should be an easy fix; PRs welcome.
body: DropoutWrapper does not have variables because it does not itself store any.  It wraps a cell that may have variables; but it's not clear what the semantics should be if you access the `DropoutWrapper.variables`.  For example, all keras layers only report back the variables that they **own**; and so only one layer ever **owns** any variable.  That said, this should probably return `[]`, and the reason it doesn't is that `DropoutWrapper` never calls `super().__init__` in its constructor.  That should be an easy fix; PRs welcome.
